title: Add /gpt-review command to trigger reviews on-demand instead of automatically
description: Add a configuration option that allows users to disable automatic PR reviews. Instead, reviews would only be triggered when a user comments with the /gpt-review command on a PR. This helps users conserve their OpenAI API tokens by only running reviews when explicitly requested. Implementation should support both modes: automatic (default, current behavior) and on-demand (new option).
close_reason: Implemented in commit b51ca4e: Added AUTO_REVIEW config option to disable automatic reviews

title: Add issue_comment event handler for /gpt-review trigger
description:
## Problem

The action only handles `pull_request.opened` and `pull_request.synchronize` events. It does NOT handle `issue_comment` events.

Looking at `src/bot.ts` line 47:
```typescript
app.on(['pull_request.opened', 'pull_request.synchronize'], async (context) => {
```

When triggered via `/gpt-review` comment:
1. Workflow runs with `issue_comment` event
2. Action's Probot handler doesn't match any registered event type
3. Action exits immediately without doing anything

## Expected Behavior

Users should be able to trigger code review on-demand by commenting `/gpt-review` on a PR.

## Proposed Solution

Add an `issue_comment.created` event handler that:
1. Checks if the comment body contains `/gpt-review`
2. Extracts the PR number from `context.payload.issue.number`
3. Fetches PR details and runs the review

## Files to Modify

- `src/bot.ts` - Add issue_comment handler
- `action.yml` - Document the new trigger capability
- `README.md` - Add usage instructions for comment trigger

title: Update README: Use repository secret instead of variable for OpenAI API key
description: The README currently instructs users to create a repository variable for OPENAI_API_KEY. This should be updated to use a repository secret instead, as secrets are encrypted and more appropriate for API keys. Update the GitHub Actions workflow documentation section.
close_reason: Implemented in commit aa1086c: Updated README to use repository secret instead of variable
